data.text: IMF Executive Board today approved US$109.4 million disbursement to help #Rwanda address the economic impact of #COVID19. This is the first COVID-19 emergency funding for an African country and we are working hard on other requests. https://t.co/s2FQO4GeDY #coronavirus #IMFAfrica https://t.co/I3vhiLeAvS
What economic measures have been taken by countries to address the #COVID19 crisis? Visit our COVID19 Policy Tracker to see the list for 193 countries. https://t.co/5NRwYcCO20 https://t.co/qvbDThjen1

Economic policy during this crisis has three objectives: Guarantee the functioning of essential sectors; Provide enough resources for people hit by the crisis; Prevent excessive economic disruption. Read how in this #IMFBlog https://t.co/EcaJ47ZQ0j #COVID19 https://t.co/Ll2mr2YpuV
What does #COVID19 mean for sub-Saharan Africa? Listen to the latest @imf_podcast https://t.co/1gArtu2sM9 https://t.co/4xEN6Xb6bo

In this crisis, greater intervention by the public sector is justified by the emergency for as long as exceptional circumstances persist, but must be provided in a transparent manner and with clear sunset clauses. #IMFBlog https://t.co/EcaJ47ZQ0j #COVID19

If policies ensure that workers do not lose their jobs, renters and homeowners are not evicted, companies avoid bankruptcy, and business and trade networks are preserved, the recovery will occur sooner and more smoothly. #COVID19 #IMFBlog https://t.co/EcaJ48hqRR https://t.co/gxg7SgVvAt

Global policymakers must enact "wartime" measures for households, businesses and the financial sector to fight the #coronavirus pandemic, say IMF economists in #IMFBlog https://t.co/EcaJ47ZQ0j #COVID19 https://t.co/WhynjXaALl
Join us to the virtual discussion on Crisis Upon Crisis: The Geopolitical & Economic Implications of the Pandemic with Jihad Azour #COVID19 https://t.co/fSCSRNZMM8 https://t.co/C28NnlkjTu
Here are the top 7 things bank supervisors can do to help banking systems weather the #COVID19 crisis? https://t.co/NnwQHdBPxk #coronavirus

Our team is working around the clock to respond to the global economic challenges posed by #COVID19. We are #inthistogether and supporting our member countries is our most important job. https://t.co/y77kQGwV1j

Bank supervisors are responding to a fast-moving and extraordinary situation brought on by the spread of #COVID19. What are the top 7 things they can do to help banking systems weather the crisis? https://t.co/NnwQHdBPxk #coronavirus https://t.co/e81BMRpGEC
Stay Tuned for the virtual discussion on Crisis Upon Crisis: The Geopolitical & Economic Implications of the Pandemic with Jihad Azour #COVID19 https://t.co/LNd8yq437g https://t.co/CPXxv7tDiE

The #COVID19 crisis continues to grow and is putting pressure on the banking system. What kinds of policies will be needed to ensure continued trust and confidence in the banking system? https://t.co/NnwQHdTqoS #coronavirus

International cooperation in action: our member countries approved a new round of bilateral borrowing as part of a broader package that will help maintain the IMF’s lending capacity of $1 trillion over the next few years. #coronavirus https://t.co/dzXeUmZ5Uj

Do you want to know what economic measures have been taken by countries to address the #COVID19 pandemic? Visit our new COVID-19 Policy Tracker to see the list for 192 economies. https://t.co/5NRwYcCO20 #coronavirus https://t.co/vfRHNcTVJ7

The #COVID19 pandemic is threatening lives and livelihoods across sub-Saharan #Africa. This will hit growth. How hard is too soon to say, but the international community needs to do its utmost to help. More on #IMFBlog: https://t.co/FXzaBzZOos #coronavirus https://t.co/DAaCtpFKQt

Middle East and Central Asia oil exporters face the double whammy of plunging oil prices and a glut in supply, on top of #COVID19. More on #IMFBlog https://t.co/ZHUU9KBR8g #coronavirus https://t.co/7KODHEK6IN

The IMF is working with governments in #MENA, Central #Asia, and the #Caucasus to lessen the economic fallout of the #COVID19 pandemic. Read more on the #IMFBlog: https://t.co/ZHUU9KBR8g #coronavirus https://t.co/Rv6pC1P3py

The IMF is fully committed to supporting its member countries during the #COVID19 pandemic. Learn more about the IMF's work to address this global challenge here: https://t.co/MmAtAVRwus #coronavirus https://t.co/EajK9Me2f4

Do you want to know what economic measures have been taken by countries to address the #COVID19 pandemic? Visit our new COVID-19 Policy Tracker to see the list for 192 economies. https://t.co/5NRwYcCO20 #coronavirus https://t.co/5qG28A66RA

IMF & @WorldBank had a good conference call with #Caucasus&CentralAsia MoFs and central banks, who have responded quickly to COVID-19. The pandemic hit the region hard. IMF & World Bank are helping with policy advice and emergency finance, including rapid finance to #Kyrgyz https://t.co/BpUbXwDaBg

While many European countries are in a position to respond forcefully to the crisis, this is not the case for some smaller non-EU Eastern European countries. We're prepared to do our part in helping these countries meet the difficulties they are facing.  https://t.co/8ppSykAl1G

European countries are responding in innovative and unfamiliar ways, and they can learn from each other. To assist them, we have established a COVID-19 policy tracker that provides info on how countries are tackling the practical problems they encounter. https://t.co/FNvlZh8o7I https://t.co/OY1OZ4Xbcy

The #COVID19 pandemic has struck Europe with stunning ferocity. While we do not know how long the crisis will last, we know that the economic impact will be severe. We stand ready to play our role in supporting #Europe. More on our latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/Fv37CsuqpV https://t.co/9axR4UnzT3

The #Kyrgyz Republic is the first to receive about $120.9 million from two of the IMF’s rapid response funds so it can spend more on health care during this #COVID19 pandemic. This first step will help people quickly and spur extra support from donors. https://t.co/u59qGVdRFj https://t.co/4q3Qz2w7YC

Without exception, people’s health is the priority. Now is not the time for half measures. Countries in sub-Saharan #Africa should boost health spending and use fiscal policy to ease the economic shock. Read more here: https://t.co/FXzaBAhpg0 #COVID19 #coronavirus #IMFBlog https://t.co/ClqUk6wikK

On the latest @IMF_podcast, IMF's Selassie says anything that will help contain the spread of #COVID19 in sub-Saharan #Africa, like closing borders to people, will help minimize added strain on already fragile health systems. https://t.co/CrflVXQYBz #IMFAfrica

.@KGeorgieva: We are being asked by our member countries to do more, and to do it better and faster than ever before. This is how we can meet this challenge. https://t.co/RbPyl9UTOu #coronavirus #COVID19 https://t.co/qmCdyfydpP

The #COVID19 challenge will be daunting for fragile + conflict-torn states—such as #Iraq, #Sudan, and #Yemen—where the difficulty of preparing weak health systems will be compounded by reduced imports. More on #IMFBlog https://t.co/ZHUU9KBR8g https://t.co/ogAcK2DSOY

US congress expedites contributions to the IMF’s resources. This decision helps solidify the IMF’s $1 trillion lending capacity at a critical time. Read the full statement: https://t.co/zgH9YxDkRR https://t.co/7D68vGbsmT
.@KGeorgieva: We are being asked by our member countries to do more, and to do it better and faster than ever before. This is how we can meet this challenge. #COVID19 https://t.co/2ePi3ucuq1

.@KGeorgieva: We have seen an extraordinary spike in requests for IMF emergency financing – some 80 countries. We also see a range of problems building up in emerging market economies. #COVID19 https://t.co/WXpntJDDsz

.@KGeorgieva: It is now clear that we have entered a recession. We project a rebound in 2021, but only if we contain the virus and prevent liquidity problems from becoming a solvency issue. https://t.co/dg8FHiuftW #COVID19 https://t.co/BIbFaRB48u

.@KGeorgieva and IMFC Chair @KganyagoLesetja: IMFC calls upon the Fund to enhance access to its emergency facilities and explore additional options to help countries that experience foreign exchange shortages. https://t.co/qq2OohhsuI

.@KGeorgieva and IMFC Chair @KganyagoLesetja: IMFC welcomed the Fund’s expeditious efforts to support a high number of emergency financing requests. The IMF stands ready to use its US$1 trillion financial capacity to support its member countries. https://t.co/qq2OohhsuI https://t.co/O2fxUXbFNS

Today the IMF & World Bank approved Somalia’s eligibility for debt relief.  This means #Somalia gains access to new financial resources from development partners to build a more prosperous future for its people. More key questions on Somalia’s debt relief https://t.co/mUgci64WSf https://t.co/isXbBg17k9

.@KGeorgieva: I am proud to announce that Somalia’s commitments to economic reforms have paid off. Somalia will gain access to new financial resources to build a more resilient & prosperous future for its people. Congratulations on this historic milestone! https://t.co/LJy0EBxZUK https://t.co/qBrYaTnsDw
#Somalia achieved a historic milestone today: the IMF and WorldBank approved the country’s eligibility for debt relief. https://t.co/LJy0EBxZUK https://t.co/YglRfyytkl
